Detailed Description

The internal representation of Pokémon information that's shown in both the party and PC.

Field Documentation

◆ personality

uint32_t pksav_gba_pc_pokemon::personality

The Pokémon's personality value, used to determine other values.

This value is stored in little-endian, so use the function pksav_littleendian32 to access or modify it.

◆ ot_id

union pksav_trainer_id pksav_gba_pc_pokemon::ot_id

This Pokémon's original trainer's ID.

◆ nickname

uint8_t pksav_gba_pc_pokemon::nickname[PKSAV_GBA_POKEMON_NICKNAME_LENGTH]

This Pokémon's nickname.

This value should be accessed with ::pksav_text_from_gba and modified with ::pksav_text_to_gba.

In all cases, the num_chars parameter should be 10.

◆ language

uint16_t pksav_gba_pc_pokemon::language

The language of this Pokémon's original game.

This value is stored in little-endian, so use the function pksav_littleendian16 to access or modify it.

◆ otname

uint8_t pksav_gba_pc_pokemon::otname[PKSAV_GBA_POKEMON_OTNAME_LENGTH]

This Pokémon's nickname.

This value should be accessed with ::pksav_text_from_gba and modified with ::pksav_text_to_gba.

In all cases, the num_chars parameter should be 7.

◆ markings

uint8_t pksav_gba_pc_pokemon::markings

This Pokémon's trainer-set markings.

These markings do not mean anything in particular and are primarily used to sort Pokémon in the PC.

◆ checksum

uint16_t pksav_gba_pc_pokemon::checksum

The checksum of the Pokémon blocks.

Users should never need to access or modify this value, as pksav_gba_save_save automatically sets all checksums.

◆ unknown_0x1E

uint16_t pksav_gba_pc_pokemon::unknown_0x1E

Unknown.

◆ blocks

struct pksav_gba_pokemon_blocks pksav_gba_pc_pokemon::blocks

Pokémon blocks.
